messages.content: You are a professional resume analyst. Analyze resumes and provide structured JSON feedback with scores, strengths, weaknesses, and ATS compatibility.

Analyze this resume for a Software Engineer position:

John Smith
john@email.com | (555) 123-4567

Experience:
Software Developer at TechCorp (2021-Present)
- Wrote code in Python
- Fixed bugs
- Attended meetings

Education:
BS Computer Science, State University, 2021

Skills: Python, JavaScript, Git

```json
{
  "overall_score": 45,
  "ats_score": 52,
  "sections": {
    "contact": {"score": 70, "feedback": "Missing LinkedIn profile and location. Add professional links."},
    "experience": {"score": 35, "feedback": "Bullet points are weak and lack metrics. 'Wrote code' and 'fixed bugs' don't demonstrate impact. Use format: Action verb + Task + Result with numbers."},
    "education": {"score": 60, "feedback": "Basic but acceptable. Add GPA if above 3.5, relevant coursework, or projects."},
    "skills": {"score": 50, "feedback": "Too few skills listed. Add frameworks (React, Django), databases (PostgreSQL), cloud (AWS), and soft skills."}
  },
  "strengths": [
    "Has relevant work experience in software development",
    "CS degree from accredited university",
    "Core programming languages listed"
  ],
  "weaknesses": [
    "No quantifiable achievements or metrics",
    "Bullet points lack action verbs and impact",
    "Missing summary/objective section",
    "Skills section is underdeveloped",
    "No projects or portfolio mentioned"
  ],
  "recommendations": [
    "Rewrite bullets using STAR method: 'Developed Python automation scripts that reduced deployment time by 40%'",
    "Add a professional summary highlighting 2+ years of experience",
    "Include GitHub profile and 2-3 notable projects",
    "Expand skills with specific technologies and tools",
    "Add keywords from job description for ATS optimization"
  ]
}
```
You are a professional resume analyst. Analyze resumes and provide structured JSON feedback with scores, strengths, weaknesses, and ATS compatibility.

Analyze this resume for a Data Scientist position:

Sarah Johnson, PhD
LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/sarahjohnson | GitHub: github.com/sjohnson
New York, NY | sarah.johnson@email.com

SUMMARY
Data Scientist with 4+ years of experience in machine learning, statistical modeling, and data analysis. Published researcher with expertise in NLP and computer vision.

EXPERIENCE
Senior Data Scientist | DataDriven Inc. | 2022-Present
• Built recommendation engine using collaborative filtering, increasing user engagement by 35%
• Deployed ML models to production using MLflow and AWS SageMaker, serving 2M+ daily predictions
• Led team of 3 data scientists, mentoring junior members and conducting code reviews

Data Scientist | Analytics Corp | 2020-2022
• Developed customer churn prediction model achieving 89% accuracy, saving $2.1M annually
• Created automated reporting dashboards in Tableau, reducing manual reporting time by 60%
• Implemented A/B testing framework for product team, running 50+ experiments

EDUCATION
PhD in Statistics, Columbia University, 2020
MS in Applied Mathematics, NYU, 2017

SKILLS
Languages: Python, R, SQL, Scala
ML/DL: TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, XGBoost
Cloud: AWS (SageMaker, EC2, S3), GCP
Tools: Spark, Airflow, Docker, Git, Tableau

PUBLICATIONS
• "Deep Learning for Text Classification" - NeurIPS 2021

```json
{
  "overall_score": 92,
  "ats_score": 95,
  "sections": {
    "contact": {"score": 100, "feedback": "Excellent! All essential info present including LinkedIn, GitHub, and location."},
    "summary": {"score": 90, "feedback": "Strong summary with years of experience, key skills, and differentiator (published researcher). Could add one specific achievement."},
    "experience": {"score": 95, "feedback": "Outstanding! Every bullet has metrics and impact. Good use of action verbs. Shows progression and leadership."},
    "education": {"score": 95, "feedback": "PhD from top university is impressive. Consider adding thesis topic if relevant."},
    "skills": {"score": 90, "feedback": "Comprehensive and well-organized. Covers languages, ML frameworks, cloud, and tools. Very ATS-friendly."},
    "extras": {"score": 85, "feedback": "Publication at NeurIPS is excellent. Consider adding certifications if any."}
  },
  "strengths": [
    "Every experience bullet includes quantifiable results",
    "Strong technical depth across ML stack",
    "PhD with publication demonstrates research ability",
    "Shows career progression (Data Scientist → Senior)",
    "Leadership experience (led team of 3)",
    "Excellent ATS optimization with keywords"
  ],
  "weaknesses": [
    "Could add 1-2 more publications or conference presentations",
    "No certifications listed (AWS ML Specialty would strengthen)",
    "Summary could include a specific flagship achievement"
  ],
  "recommendations": [
    "Add AWS Machine Learning Specialty certification if you have it",
    "Consider adding a 'Projects' section with open-source contributions",
    "Include thesis title under PhD if relevant to data science",
    "Add 'Open to relocation' if applicable for more opportunities"
  ]
}
```
You are a professional resume analyst. Analyze resumes and provide structured JSON feedback with scores, strengths, weaknesses, and ATS compatibility.

Analyze this resume for an Entry-Level Marketing position:

Emma Wilson
emma.w@gmail.com

Objective: Seeking a marketing position where I can learn and grow.

Education:
BA Marketing, Community College, 2024
GPA: 3.2

Experience:
Marketing Intern | Local Business | Summer 2023
- Helped with social media
- Made some graphics
- Answered customer emails

Retail Associate | Mall Store | 2021-2023
- Helped customers
- Worked cash register
- Stocked shelves

Skills:
- Microsoft Office
- Social media
- Photoshop (beginner)

```json
{
  "overall_score": 38,
  "ats_score": 35,
  "sections": {
    "contact": {"score": 40, "feedback": "Missing phone number, LinkedIn, portfolio link, and location. These are essential for recruiters."},
    "objective": {"score": 25, "feedback": "Too generic. 'Learn and grow' doesn't tell employers what you offer. Replace with a Summary highlighting your specific marketing skills and what value you bring."},
    "education": {"score": 55, "feedback": "GPA is decent but not outstanding. Add relevant coursework, marketing projects, or campus involvement to strengthen this section."},
    "experience": {"score": 30, "feedback": "Both positions lack metrics and specific achievements. 'Helped with social media' could be 'Managed Instagram account, growing followers by 200+ in 3 months'."},
    "skills": {"score": 35, "feedback": "Too vague and basic. List specific platforms (Instagram, TikTok, Google Analytics), tools (Canva, Hootsuite), and marketing skills (SEO, content writing)."}
  },
  "strengths": [
    "Has relevant internship experience in marketing",
    "Customer-facing experience shows communication skills",
    "Recent graduate with marketing degree"
  ],
  "weaknesses": [
    "No quantifiable achievements in any position",
    "Objective statement is generic and weak",
    "Skills section lacks specific marketing tools",
    "Missing LinkedIn and portfolio",
    "Bullet points start with weak verbs ('helped', 'made')",
    "No projects, certifications, or extracurriculars"
  ],
  "recommendations": [
    "Replace objective with Summary: 'Marketing graduate with hands-on internship experience in social media management and content creation. Skilled in Canva, Instagram, and customer engagement.'",
    "Quantify internship work: 'Created 25+ social media graphics using Canva, contributing to 15% increase in engagement'",
    "Add Google Analytics, HubSpot, or Meta certifications (free online)",
    "Include class projects as 'Projects' section",
    "Create a simple portfolio website to showcase work",
    "Reframe retail experience: 'Delivered exceptional customer service to 50+ daily customers' shows transferable skills",
    "Add LinkedIn URL - essential for marketing roles"
  ]
}
```
You are a professional resume analyst. Analyze resumes and provide structured JSON feedback with scores, strengths, weaknesses, and ATS compatibility.

Analyze this resume for a Product Manager position:

Michael Chen | San Francisco, CA
mchen@email.com | linkedin.com/in/michaelchen | 415-555-0123

PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY
Product Manager with 6 years of experience driving product strategy for B2B SaaS platforms. Track record of launching products that generated $15M+ in ARR. Expertise in user research, agile methodologies, and cross-functional team leadership.

EXPERIENCE

Senior Product Manager | CloudTech Solutions | 2021-Present
• Owned roadmap for enterprise analytics platform serving 500+ Fortune 1000 clients
• Launched self-service dashboard feature, reducing customer support tickets by 45% and increasing NPS from 32 to 58
• Partnered with engineering (12 developers) and design (3 designers) to ship 4 major releases annually
• Conducted 100+ customer interviews and synthesized insights into actionable product requirements
• Implemented OKR framework for product team, improving sprint velocity by 30%

Product Manager | StartupXYZ | 2019-2021
• Led development of mobile app from 0 to 50K MAU in 18 months
• Defined MVP scope and prioritized features using RICE framework, launching 3 weeks ahead of schedule
• Established product analytics using Amplitude, creating dashboards for key metrics (retention, activation, engagement)

Associate Product Manager | BigCorp Inc. | 2018-2019
• Supported senior PM on checkout optimization, contributing to 12% increase in conversion rate
• Created PRDs and user stories for engineering team
• Ran weekly sprint planning and retrospective meetings

EDUCATION
MBA, UC Berkeley Haas School of Business, 2018
BS Computer Science, Stanford University, 2016

SKILLS
Product: Roadmapping, User Research, A/B Testing, Agile/Scrum, OKRs, PRDs
Tools: Jira, Confluence, Figma, Amplitude, Mixpanel, SQL, Tableau
Certifications: Pragmatic Marketing Certified (PMC-III), Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO)

```json
{
  "overall_score": 96,
  "ats_score": 98,
  "sections": {
    "contact": {"score": 100, "feedback": "Perfect. All essential contact info present and professionally formatted."},
    "summary": {"score": 98, "feedback": "Excellent! Quantified experience (6 years, $15M ARR), clear value proposition, and specific expertise areas. This immediately communicates seniority and impact."},
    "experience": {"score": 98, "feedback": "Outstanding. Every bullet demonstrates impact with metrics. Shows progression from APM to Senior PM. Excellent mix of strategic and tactical responsibilities."},
    "education": {"score": 95, "feedback": "MBA from top school + CS degree from Stanford is ideal for PM roles. Strong credentials."},
    "skills": {"score": 95, "feedback": "Well-organized by category. Includes both PM frameworks and tools. Certifications add credibility."}
  },
  "strengths": [
    "Every experience bullet has quantifiable impact",
    "Clear career progression (APM → PM → Senior PM)",
    "Strong blend of technical background (CS) and business (MBA)",
    "Demonstrates cross-functional leadership",
    "Shows customer-centricity (100+ interviews, NPS improvement)",
    "Industry-relevant certifications",
    "Perfect ATS keyword optimization"
  ],
  "weaknesses": [
    "Could add a notable product launch or feature as a headline achievement",
    "No mention of specific industries or verticals (could narrow focus)"
  ],
  "recommendations": [
    "Consider adding a 'Key Achievement' line at top: 'Launched analytics platform feature driving $5M ARR'",
    "If targeting specific companies, tailor summary to mention relevant domain experience",
    "Could add thought leadership (blog posts, speaking engagements) if applicable",
    "This resume is already excellent - minimal changes needed"
  ]
}
```
You are a professional resume analyst. Analyze resumes and provide structured JSON feedback with scores, strengths, weaknesses, and ATS compatibility.

Analyze this resume for a UX Designer position:

Alex Rivera
Portfolio: alexrivera.design
Email: alex@designmail.com | Phone: 555-987-6543
Seattle, WA

ABOUT ME
I'm a passionate designer who loves creating beautiful user experiences. I believe design should be both functional and delightful. Looking for opportunities to grow my skills at an innovative company.

WORK HISTORY

Designer at Agency ABC (2022-Now)
- Designed websites and apps for clients
- Created wireframes and prototypes
- Worked with developers to implement designs
- Participated in client meetings

Junior Designer at Small Studio (2020-2022)
- Made graphics and layouts
- Updated existing websites
- Learned new design tools

EDUCATION
BFA Graphic Design, Art Institute, 2020

PROGRAMS I USE
Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, InVision

```json
{
  "overall_score": 48,
  "ats_score": 42,
  "sections": {
    "contact": {"score": 85, "feedback": "Good inclusion of portfolio link! Add LinkedIn profile for professional networking."},
    "about": {"score": 30, "feedback": "Too personal and vague. Replace with professional Summary that highlights years of experience, key skills (user research, prototyping), and specific impact. Remove 'passionate' and 'delightful' - show don't tell."},
    "experience": {"score": 40, "feedback": "Bullets lack specifics and metrics. What types of apps? How many users? What was the impact? 'Designed websites' could be 'Designed responsive e-commerce website for retail client, increasing mobile conversions by 25%'."},
    "education": {"score": 60, "feedback": "BFA is appropriate for design roles. Consider adding relevant coursework, thesis project, or honors."},
    "skills": {"score": 55, "feedback": "Good tools listed but missing UX-specific skills. Add: User Research, Usability Testing, Information Architecture, Design Systems, Accessibility (WCAG)."}
  },
  "strengths": [
    "Has portfolio website (essential for designers)",
    "3+ years of design experience",
    "Relevant degree in design field",
    "Experience with industry-standard tools"
  ],
  "weaknesses": [
    "No metrics or quantifiable results",
    "'About Me' section is unprofessional and vague",
    "Job titles are generic ('Designer' vs 'UX Designer')",
    "Missing UX-specific terminology (user research, usability testing)",
    "No case studies or project highlights",
    "Bullets use weak language ('made', 'learned')"
  ],
  "recommendations": [
    "Rewrite summary: 'UX Designer with 3+ years creating user-centered digital experiences for web and mobile. Expertise in user research, wireframing, and design systems. Portfolio includes projects for clients in e-commerce, fintech, and healthcare.'",
    "Add metrics: 'Redesigned checkout flow resulting in 30% reduction in cart abandonment'",
    "Change job titles to reflect UX focus: 'UX/UI Designer' instead of just 'Designer'",
    "Add a 'Featured Projects' section highlighting 2-3 case studies with outcomes",
    "Include UX skills: User Research, Journey Mapping, A/B Testing, WCAG Accessibility",
    "Add certifications: Google UX Design Certificate, Nielsen Norman Group courses",
    "Include LinkedIn profile URL"
  ]
}
```
